intro: Isolepis oryzetorum, commonly known as the rice marsh grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered spikelets. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Isolepis oryzetorum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to fluctuating water levels.
